𝗩𝗜𝗥𝗧𝗨𝗔𝗟𝗕𝗢𝗫-𝗪𝗘𝗕-𝗣𝗔𝗡𝗘𝗟 | Managing VirtualBox virtual machines through a web browser.  

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🐍 Python 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Managing VirtualBox virtual machines through a web browser.
📅 Created: Apr 2025 • Updated: May 2025

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ List VMs
✅ Control Actions (start, stop, save state)
✅ Keystroke Injection
✅ Screenshot Capture
✅ VM Status Indicator
✅ VM Details Sidebar
✅ Responsive Web Interface
✅ Notification System


❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐ 5 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 0 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 0 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

The VirtualBox Web Control Panel provides a web interface to manage VirtualBox virtual machines. It allows users to list, control, and interact with VMs by starting, stopping, saving state, sending keystrokes, and viewing live screenshots. The panel is designed to be lightweight and easy to deploy, requiring only Python 3's standard libraries and `VBoxManage`.

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

🔗 𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗞𝗦
• 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗛𝘂𝗯: https://github.com/nv1t/virtualbox-web-panel

𝗠𝗘𝗘𝗧𝗜𝗡𝗚-𝗠𝗜𝗡𝗨𝗧𝗘𝗦 | Automatically capturing, transcribing, and summarizing meeting content locally, ensuring user privacy and eliminating the need for external servers.  🔥 Super Hot!

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🔨 C++ 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Automatically capturing, transcribing, and summarizing meeting content locally, ensuring user privacy and eliminating the need for external servers.
📅 Created: Dec 2024 • Updated: May 2025

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Live meeting audio capture
✅ Real-time transcription
✅ AI-powered meeting summaries
✅ Local device processing for privacy
✅ Cross-platform support (macOS, Windows, Linux - in development)


♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐⭐ 5K 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 347 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 28 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

The meeting-minutes repository provides an AI-powered meeting assistant that captures live audio, transcribes it in real-time, and generates summaries. It's designed to run locally on user devices, ensuring privacy. The application supports macOS and Windows, with Linux support planned, and aims to automate meeting note-taking and summarization.

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

𝗖𝗔𝗣𝗦-𝗟𝗢𝗚 | Personal journaling with a focus on tracking habits and activities through tag and section-based organization and visualization.  🔥 Super Hot!

✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🔨 C++ 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Personal journaling with a focus on tracking habits and activities through tag and section-based organization and visualization.
📅 Created: Apr 2022 • Updated: May 2025

✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Terminal-based journaling
✅ Markdown log storage
✅ Section and tag extraction for menu display
✅ Calendar highlighting based on tag/section selection
✅ Integration with `$EDITOR` for log editing
✅ Remote storage via Git repository
✅ AES encryption for logs


✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐ 232 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 7 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 11 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Caps-Log is a terminal-based journaling tool that stores entries as Markdown files. It extracts sections and tags to create interactive menus, allowing users to visualize their activities on a calendar. The tool also supports integration with external editors, remote storage via Git, and AES encryption for logs.

✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

𝗖𝗨𝗔 | Enabling AI agents to control full operating systems within high-performance, lightweight virtual containers for tasks like interacting with applications, browsing the web, and writing code.  🔥 Super Hot!

✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🐍 Python 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Enabling AI agents to control full operating systems within high-performance, lightweight virtual containers for tasks like interacting with applications, browsing the web, and writing code.
📅 Created: Jan 2025 • Updated: May 2025

✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ High-performance virtualization using Apple's Virtualization.Framework
✅ Framework for AI agents to observe and control virtual environments
✅ Near-native performance on Apple Silicon (up to 97% of native speed)
✅ Support for macOS and Linux environments
✅ Built-in support for connecting to various LLM providers


✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐⭐ 5.3K 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 209 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 39 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Cua is a framework that provides high-performance virtualization and a computer-use interface for AI agents. It allows AI systems to observe and control virtual macOS or Linux environments on Apple Silicon with near-native performance. This enables secure, reproducible, and flexible AI agent workflows with built-in LLM integration.

✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

• 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗛𝘂𝗯: https://github.com/trycua/cua

𝗛𝗘𝗖𝗧𝗢𝗥-𝗥𝗔𝗚 | Building Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines for AI-driven applications using PostgreSQL as a vector database.  🔥 Super Hot!

❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🐍 Python 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Building Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines for AI-driven applications using PostgreSQL as a vector database.
📅 Created: Feb 2025 • Updated: May 2025

❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Multiple RAG retrieval methods (Similarity Search, Keyword Search, Graph Retrieval, KAG)
✅ Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF) for combining multiple retrieval methods
✅ Built on PostgreSQL vector database
✅ Modular architecture
✅ Advanced RAG pipeline creation capabilities


❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀

⭐⭐ 52 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 3 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 3 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Hector RAG is a modular RAG framework built on PostgreSQL, offering advanced retrieval methods and fusion techniques. It enables developers to create sophisticated RAG pipelines for AI applications, leveraging the efficiency of PostgreSQL for vector storage and retrieval. The framework supports multiple retrieval methods and Reciprocal Rank Fusion for enhanced accuracy.

❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀

FlorisBoard is an open-source keyboard for Android that prioritizes user privacy and customization. It offers features like a clipboard manager, advanced theming, extension support, and an emoji keyboard. The project is currently in early-beta and aims to be modern and user-friendly.

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Faviconic is a JavaScript tool that allows users to run simple games or animations inside a browser tab's favicon. It leverages AppleScript to open multiple Chrome windows and requires a local Python HTTP server to serve the game content. The primary use case is to display simple, visually engaging content within the limited space of a favicon.
